data.title: Anyone know the last version that supported Windows Server 2003?
data.meta_description: And does it have the Include "Older than X hours" option? I really need it to automate the deletion of older files. Thanks!
data.text:
And does it have the Include "Older than X hours" option?

I really need it to automate the deletion of older files.

Thanks!

As I recall, the last version of CCleaner to support Windows Server 2003 Service Pack 2 would have been the CCleaner 5.64 sunset release for Windows XP and Vista users available here: https://www.ccleaner.com/ccleaner/builds.

Although technically anyone running Windows Server should be using a paid CCleaner licence, we have not been enforcing this for XP/Visa/2003 users for the past 2 years since we stopped providing updates for those OSes, and outdated versions of CCleaner are not supported.

At the risk of telling you something you already know, Windows 2003 support from Microsoft ended in 2010, with extended support ending in 2015. Unless you have the Windows Server 2003 May 2017 emergency security patch applied (and even if you do, given that the Windows Server 2003 source code was leaked back in 2020) I'd recommend against against having this computer on any network connected to the internet.
